abstract: The United States accused Bank of America of a ‘brazen’ mortgage fraud. | An ex-Goldman director was sentenced to two years in an insider case. | Andrew Ross Sorkin said Ben Bernanke has told close friends that he probably will not stay on for another term. | A look back on our reporting of the past week’s highs and lows in finance.
snippet: The United States accused Bank of America of a ‘brazen’ mortgage fraud. | An ex-Goldman director was sentenced to two years in an insider case. | Andrew Ross Sorkin said Ben Bernanke has told close friends that he probably will not stay on for ano...
lead_paragraph: There is an old defense trotted out by journalists that their reporting must be fair if both Republicans and Democrats are upset with them. If that is the case, then government officials can take some pleasure from the bipartisan complaints of their disjointed efforts to clean up the mortgage mess.

headline.main: Week in Review: Bank Suit Draws Fire Across Political Spectrum
